title: 109_hr3896
content: The Act is titled the "Hurricane Katrina Emergency Relief CDBG Flexibility Act of 2005" and suspends the public services cap. The "Hurricane Katrina Emergency Relief CDBG Flexibility Act of 2005" suspends percentage limitations on assistance for public services by units of local government or Indian tribes in directly and indirectly affected communities for fiscal years 2005 through 2008. The Secretary may waive percentage limitations on assistance for public services in indirectly affected communities during specified fiscal years under the Housing and Community Development Act of 1974. The waiver considers the economic circumstances of each community. Assistance under the Housing and Community Development Act of 1974 can be used for public services in directly affected communities without percentage limitations. This includes nonentitlement communities, and the amounts used in directly affected communities do not count towards statewide limitations. SEC. 3. SUSPENSION OF PUBLIC HEARING REQUIREMENT. The Secretary may waive public hearing requirements for grants under section 106 of the Housing and Community Development Act of 1974 for directly affected communities in fiscal year 2006. This includes waiving requirements for holding public hearings and making certifications in citizenship participation plans. The Secretary may waive public hearing requirements for grants under section 106 of the Housing and Community Development Act of 1974 for directly affected communities in fiscal year 2006, including any requirement to hold public hearings. SEC. 4. DEFINITIONS. The Act defines "directly affected community" as a local government unit impacted by a major disaster declaration related to Hurricane Katrina or Rita, and "indirectly affected community" as a metropolitan city, urban county, or Indian tribe not within a directly affected community. The term "directly affected community" refers to a local government impacted by Hurricane Katrina or Rita, while the term "indirectly affected community" includes metropolitan cities, urban counties, or Indian tribes not within a directly affected community. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development determines communities significantly affected economically by the hurricanes. The House of Representatives passed the document on October 6, 2005.
